text.more:
What is this?

This is an algorithmically generated map of Twitch

  • Each bubble is a Twitch channel.
  • Each edge represents the overlap of chatters between those two channels. All edges on this map represent an overlap of at least 1000 chatters.
  • The colors are algorithmically assigned by detecting communities.
  • The layout of the map was constructed using force directed layout algorithms.


Website Controls

  • Left click and drag to pan.
  • Scroll to zoom. Trackpad zoom might not work very well but the zoom in, out, and center buttons at the bottom should help out in that case.
  • Click on a channel to see channel info and filter the map to only that channel's connections (ie. channels that have more share more than 1000 chatters with the selected channel).
  • The label behavior can be a bit strange, center the map via the bottom button to reset everything.
  • Mobile viewing is currently not supported.


I have not done too much web development like this so please be patient as I learn what works and what doesn't. A large map of YouTube project is nearing completion and this is acting as a trial run for that website, look out for that if your interested!

This is an open source project made with SigmaJS and Gephi, find resources here.
